UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile within the RuralCare AI platform, encompassing patients, CHWs, specialists, and administrators.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserProfile entity.

role.description: The user's role (e.g., patient, CHW, specialist, administrator).

chwId.description: The ID of the CHW assigned to this patient.

phoneNumbers.description: Array of phone numbers associated with the user.

demographicInfo.description: JSON string containing demographic information about the user.

medicalHistory.description: JSON string containing the user's medical history.

deviceInformation.description: JSON string containing information about the user's device.

assignedCoverageArea.description: The coverage area assigned to the user (if CHW)

performanceMetrics.description: JSON string containing performance metrics of user, such as consultation success rates.

trainingCompletionStatus.description: Training completion status of the user.

equipmentInventory.description: JSON string representing the equipment inventory assigned to a user (e.g. CHW).

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the user profile was created.

Consultation.title: Consultation
Consultation.description: Represents a consultation record, capturing patient symptoms, AI analysis results, and related information.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Consultation entity.

symptoms.description: Text or voice input describing the patient's symptoms.

aiAnalysisResults.description: JSON string containing the AI analysis results of the consultation.

medicalImages.description: Array of URIs to medical images associated with the consultation.

vitalSigns.description: JSON string containing the patient's vital signs.

preliminaryDiagnosis.description: Preliminary diagnosis based on the consultation.

riskAssessment.description: Risk assessment for the patient's condition.

referralRequired.description: Indicates whether a specialist referral is required.

followUpRequirements.description: JSON string containing follow-up requirements for the patient.

consultationDate.description: Date and time of the consultation.

sessionRecordingUri.description: URI for the video recording of the telemedicine session

chatTranscript.description: JSON string of the chat transcript from the telemedicine session.

HealthEducationContent.title: HealthEducationContent
HealthEducationContent.description: Represents multilingual health education content, including articles, videos, and audio materials.

id.description: Unique identifier for the HealthEducationContent entity.

contentType.description: Type of content (e.g., article, video, audio).

title.description: Title of the health education content.

description.description: Description of the health education content.

contentUri.description: URI to the actual health education content.

language.description: Language of the health education content.

category.description: Category of the health education content (e.g., prevention, treatment).

engagementMetrics.description: JSON string containing engagement metrics (e.g., views, likes).

AiModel.title: AiModel
AiModel.description: Represents an AI model used within the platform, including version, metrics, and training data.

id.description: Unique identifier for the AIModel entity.

performanceMetrics.description: JSON string containing performance metrics of the AI model.

trainingDataInformation.description: Information about the training data used for the AI model.

deploymentStatus.description: Deployment status of the AI model.

modelUri.description: URI to the AI model file.

TelemedicineSession.title: TelemedicineSession
TelemedicineSession.description: Represents a telemedicine session, managing participant details, recordings, and outcomes.

id.description: Unique identifier for the TelemedicineSession entity.

sessionStartTime.description: Start time of the telemedicine session.

sessionEndTime.description: End time of the telemedicine session.

status.description: The current status of the telemedicine session.

sessionRecordingUri.description: URI to the recording of the telemedicine session.

roomUrl.description: The URL for the WebRTC video call room.

chatTranscript.description: JSON string containing the chat transcript from the session.

sessionOutcomes.description: JSON string containing the outcomes of the telemedicine session.

qualityRating.description: Quality rating of the telemedicine session.

webRtcIntegrationDetails.description: JSON string with details about the WebRTC integration

sessionAnalytics.description: JSON string with analytics about the telemedicine session.

EmergencyAlert.title: EmergencyAlert
EmergencyAlert.description: Represents an emergency alert triggered by the system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the EmergencyAlert entity.

location.description: JSON string containing the location of the emergency.

alertTimestamp.description: Timestamp when the alert was triggered.

notifiedContacts.description: Array of user IDs of emergency contacts notified.

respondedChwIds.description: Array of UserProfile IDs of CHWs who responded to the emergency alert.

Specialist.title: Specialist
Specialist.description: Represents a medical specialist available for referrals.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Specialist entity.

specialty.description: The medical specialty of the specialist (e.g., Cardiology, Dermatology).

location.description: The city or clinic location of the specialist.

imageUrl.description: URL for a profile image of the specialist.

Referral.title: Referral
Referral.description: Represents a patient referral to a specialist.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Referral entity.

patientId.description: The ID of the patient being referred.

specialistId.description: The ID of the specialist the patient is referred to.

chwId.description: The ID of the CHW who initiated the referral (if applicable).

status.description: The current status of the referral.

notes.description: Notes or reason for the referral.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the referral was created.

Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents a task assigned to a Community Health Worker (CHW).

chwId.description: The ID of the CHW the task is assigned to.

patientId.description: The ID of the patient this task relates to (optional).

patientName.description: The denormalized name of the patient for quick display.

title.description: A concise title for the task.

description.description: A detailed description of the task.

dueDate.description: The date when the task is due.

status.description: The current status of the task.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the task was created.

Vaccine.title: Vaccine
Vaccine.description: Represents a specific type of vaccine available in the library.

name.description: The common name of the vaccine.

disease.description: The disease(s) the vaccine protects against.

age.description: The recommended age or target group for the vaccine.

description.description: A detailed description of the vaccine.

UserVaccineRecord.title: UserVaccineRecord
UserVaccineRecord.description: Represents a record of a vaccine administered to a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the vaccination record.

vaccineId.description: Reference to the ID of the vaccine in the main vaccine library.

dateAdministered.description: The date the vaccine was administered.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to prioritize authorization independence, clarity, and security. It leverages denormalization and structural segregation to achieve these goals. User profiles are stored in a dedicated collection, with roles explicitly defined within each user document. Consultations, Telemedicine Sessions, and Emergency Alerts are structured as subcollections of user profiles (patients, CHWs, specialists) to ensure clear ownership and simplify security rules. Health education content is stored in a dedicated collection with public read access. AI models are stored in a separate collection with restricted access.  Authorization Independence is achieved by denormalizing relevant authorization data (e.g., CHW's assigned coverage area) into child documents. This avoids the need for `get()` calls in security rules. QAPs (Rules are not Filters) are supported through structural segregation. For instance, the `health_education_content` collection is explicitly designed for public read access, allowing listing without complex filtering based on user roles or permissions. The `specialists` collection is public to allow browsing, and the `referrals` collection holds all referral data, with access control to be managed by security rules.
